results.title: Feathers and Fools
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Mem Fox. This is a parable about two groups of birds - swans and peacocks - who are greatly afraid of their respective differences.

results.title: Feast or famine
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
The number of people at the world’s “dinner table” is expected to at least double in the next few decades. Can human beings find a way to provide or restore rich, green, fertile lands to Spaceship Earth? This program examines comparative studies in France, ancient growing traditions and life in Samoa, and the importance of food in specific cultures. Desertification and erosion in Kenya is also examined.

results.title: Feast of St. Isidore and The Horrors of war (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Sergio Amidei, Colonna Film and Luciano Emmer
results.brief_description: This film is more that a record of Goya’s work; it is also an interpretation of the philosophy of the man himself. Two sharply differing aspects are depicted: in “The Feast of St Isidore” Goya sketched the festivities in Madrid, the excitement of the bullfight and the mixed adoration and fear in the faces of the people at the evening procession of the Virgin; in “The Horrors of War” Goya depicted all the cruelty, fear and violence of the Napoleonic invasion and the grief and pain which followe it. The film concludes with a vision of drawings showing the sadness and futility of human existence.

results.title: Fearless: stories from Asian women
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Samantha Kelley, Peter Du Cane and Matthew Kelley
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the experiences of four women fighting for social justice. Each is from a different culture but they are united by a refusal to remain silent and by their pursuit of human rights justice. Explosive devices tells the story of Doris Nuval, a former terrorist who is utilizing the power of television to bring justice to the Philippines. The Price of freedom outlays Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasrins struggle against womens oppression and the forces of fundamentalism. Breaking the caste investigates Fathima Burnards aim to empower the Dalait women of India, thus changing a 3000 year old caste system. Heart on the sleeve Hien Tran is the voice for thousands of Australian outworkers who work for a pittance, under exploitative circumstances.

results.title: Fear woman
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Elspeth MacDougall
results.brief_description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.

results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.

results.title: Fear
results.creator_credit: Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer, Ric Kidney and James Foley
results.brief_description: An intense psychological thriller about violence amongst teens starring Mark Wahlberg, Reese Witherspoon, Alyssa Milano, William Petersen and Amy Brenneman. Nicole Walker (Witherspoon) is a typical high school student who lives with her affluent and overprotective father (Petersen) and his new wife (Brenneman). Rebelling against him, Nicole sneaks out of the house with her best friend Margo (Milano) to a club, where she meets attractive bad-boy David McCall (Wahlberg in one of his first lead roles). Despite her father’s reservations about her first serious boyfriend and his questionable friends, Nicole falls head-over-heels for him and is shocked when his true possessive and violent nature is revealed. Ending their relationship, she tries to move on with her life. David has other plans, stalking Nicole and terrorising her family and friends, culminating in an attack on Nicole’s home. Set in Seattle, ‘Fear’ shows just how easy a seemingly perfect lifestyle can be altered by violence, with Nicole’s wealthy, privileged lifestyle overlapping with David’s underworld grunge life.
